Class EntityBuffer

  • java.lang.Object
    • Buffer
      • EntityBuffer

  • public class EntityBuffer
extends Buffer
    The EntityBuffer class is used for taking information from the Entity components of the game and formatting it into a display.

    EntityBuffer

    Date: 2016/05/26

    Version:
    1 2016/05/26
    Author:
    David White and Sepehr Hosseini

    • Field Summary

      • Fields inherited from class Buffer

        tileSize, view

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      EntityBuffer(NPC[] computerCharacters)
      This constructor creates an instance of the EntityBuffer class to show the specified NPC objects.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void centerView(int x, int y)
      This method is intended to center the view of the buffer around the specified x and y coordinates in relation to the game components passed into it.
      void moveCharacter(int x)
      This method moves the character at the specified index in the NPC array based on the direction of the NPC.
      void resetCharacter(int x)
      This method resets the movement of the character.
      void update()
      This method is intended to update the buffer image based on the game components.

      • Methods inherited from class Buffer

        getView, renderHeight, renderWidth

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • EntityBuffer

        public EntityBuffer(NPC[] computerCharacters)
        This constructor creates an instance of the EntityBuffer class to show the specified NPC objects.
        Parameters:
        computerCharacters[] - the NPC objects that are passed in to be shown.

    • Method Detail

      • centerView

        public void centerView(int x,
                       int y)
        This method is intended to center the view of the buffer around the specified x and y coordinates in relation to the game components passed into it.
        Specified by:
        centerView in class Buffer
        Parameters:
        x - the x coordinate.
        y - the y coordinate.

      • moveCharacter

        public void moveCharacter(int x)
        This method moves the character at the specified index in the NPC array based on the direction of the NPC.
        Parameters:
        x - the index of the character to be moved.

      • resetCharacter

        public void resetCharacter(int x)
        This method resets the movement of the character.
        Parameters:
        x - the index of the character to be moved.

      • update

        public void update()
        This method is intended to update the buffer image based on the game components.

        Local variables:

        g2D Reference to the Graphics2D class which will be used to draw images onto the screen.

        Specified by:
        update in class Buffer
